23 Working memory is preserved by recurrent excitation as well as by functional interaction of G‐proteins coupled α2‐adrenoreceptors with colocalized in dendritic spines hyperpolarization‐activated channels (HCN) of prefrontal cortical neurons, Figure 12. This interaction is mediated via endogenous cAMP, which at high level promotes opening, while at low level, induces blockage of HCN channels. HCN channels opening shunts synaptic transmission onto dendritic spines, decreases cognitive performance in animals performing working memory tasks and thus improving quality of arousal and working memory, which is essential for abstract thinking, planning, and executive functions.
